.
Timely Scheduling of Hearings
Schedule hearings within a reasonable amount of time from the date the request is received.  For pre-determination hearings, schedule the hearing for the earliest available date.
Note
:  For legacy appeal hearings, the following are all relevant to whether a hearing is scheduled in a reasonable amount of time:
the stage that the legacy appeal is in (NOD or substantive appeal)
the average pendency of legacy appeals in the stage
the individual’s appellate caseload, and
the existence of older and priority hearing requests to satisfy
.
Important
:  Expedite scheduling of hearings for all cases entitled to priority handling.
Reference
:  For more information on scheduling BVA hearings, see
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section H
.
